title: Manchester United news: Scott McTominay makes Premier League history against Norwich
text:
Scott McTominay put Manchester United ahead against Norwich (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United midfielder Scott McTominay put his name in the record books this afternoon by scoring the 2000th goal in the club’s Premier League history.

The Scotland international put the Red Devils ahead at Carrow Road with a fine effort from just inside the area.

United have been struggling for goals of late but it was the club’s 2000th goal of the Premier League era – meaning they’re the first side to reach the landmark.

It got even better for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s men when Marcus Rashford converted Daniel James’ pass to double their lead.

It could have been far more comfortable for United at the break as they missed two penalties.

Rashford was guilty first as Tim Krul saved brilliantly, while it was Anthony Martial that then fluffed his lines shortly before the break.

Advertisement

Advertisement

But Martial made amends after the break when he finished off a fantastic team move to lift the ball over Krul.

Onel Hernandez scored a late consolation goal for Norwich but it could not take the shine off United’s display, which was there first away win in the league since February.
